Step 1: Combine part 1 and part 2 Create the final assembly by combining part 1 and part 2 using the "JoinFeatureOperation" boolean operation. The design includes the required shapes, dimensions, loops, and face details according to the given JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the Base of the Metal Plate Construct the base of the metal plate by following these instructions: 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles `(0, 0, 0)` and translation vector `(0, 0, 0)`. 2. Draw the first face of the base plate: a. Draw the first line from `(0, 0)` to `(0.2727, 0)`. b. Draw the second line from `(0.2727, 0)` to `(0.2727, 0.75)`. c. Draw the third line from `(0.2727, 0.75)` to `(0, 0.75)`. d. Draw the fourth line from `(0, 0.75)` to `(0, 0)`. 3. Create a loop with the single line sketch from step 2. 4. Create the first circle in the second loop using the center `(0.0715, 0.6767)` and a radius of 0.0218. 5. Create the second circle in the third loop using the center `(0.1364, 0.1046)` and a radius of 0.0218. 6. Create the third circle in the fourth loop using the center `(0.2077, 0.668)` and a radius of 0.0218. 7. Scale the entire base plate sketch by a factor of 0.75. 8. Extrude the base plate sketch by 0.0436 units along the normal direction. Part 2: Adding the First Hole Create the first hole by following these instructions: 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles `(0, 0, 0)` and translation vector `(0, 0, 0)`. 2. Repeat steps 2 to 7 from Part 1 with the same dimensions. 3. Perform a Join Feature Operation to combine the new part with the base plate (Part 1). Part 3: Adding the Second Hole Create the second hole by following these instructions: 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles `(0, 0, 0)` and translation vector `(0, 0, 0)`. 2. Repeat steps 2 to 7 from Part 1 with the same dimensions. 3. Perform a Join Feature Operation to combine the new part with the combined base plate and the first hole (Part 1 and Part 2). After finishing Part 3, you will get a rectangular metal plate with two holes on one side. The dimensions for each part are as follows: * Base plate (Part 1): 0.75 units in length and width with 0.0436 units in height. * First hole (Part 2): 0.75 units in length and width with 0.0436 units in height. * Second hole (Part 3): 0.75 units in length and width with 0.0436 units in height. * Final shape: 0.75 units in length and width with 0.0436 units in height.</description>
